meanings.definition: To withdraw from one's occupation or position
meanings.sent1: After many years of hard work, she decided to retire from her job at the factory.
meanings.sent2: It is common for people to retire around the age of 65 in many countries.
meanings.sent3: The old professor decided to retire from teaching and spend his days fishing by the lake.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set on his career, he knew it was time to retire and pass the torch to the younger generation.
meanings.sent5: The decision to retire can bring a mix of emotions, from excitement to uncertainty.

meanings.sent1: After a long day of work, she was eager to retire to her cozy bed for a good night's sleep.
meanings.sent2: Children are usually asked to retire to bed early on school nights.
meanings.sent3: The tired puppy decided to retire to his bed and snuggle up with his favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: As the clock struck midnight, Cinderella had to retire from the ball and return home.
meanings.sent5: The soothing sound of rain made it easy for her to retire early and enjoy a peaceful sleep.

meanings.sent1: The troops were ordered to retire from the battlefield to regroup and strategize.
meanings.sent2: As the storm approached, the villagers had to retire to safer ground.
meanings.sent3: The shy turtle would often retire into its shell when feeling threatened.
meanings.sent4: The waves began to retire from the shore, leaving behind seashells and seaweed.
meanings.sent5: The old bridge had to retire due to safety concerns, making way for a new one to be built.

meanings.sent1: The deer would retire into the forest whenever they sensed danger approaching.
meanings.sent2: When faced with criticism, he would often retire from the conversation to avoid conflict.
meanings.sent3: The magician made the rabbit retire from the stage in a puff of smoke.
meanings.sent4: As the night fell, the shadows began to retire, giving way to the light of dawn.
meanings.sent5: The old sailor decided to retire from the sea and live a quiet life in a small coastal town.

meanings.definition: To stop participating in a game or competition
meanings.sent1: After scoring the winning goal, the injured player had to retire from the match.
meanings.sent2: In chess, a player can retire from the game if they feel they are at a disadvantage.
meanings.sent3: The tired marathon runner had to retire from the race due to exhaustion.
meanings.sent4: The aging boxer knew it was time to retire from the ring and enjoy retirement.
meanings.sent5: The injured athlete had to retire from the competition, but vowed to come back stronger next season.
